introduction.section1: Among the countless islands of Indonesia, let's head to Komodo. Located in the Southeast Islands, between Sumbawa and Flores, it is part of a group of islands called the Lesser Sunda Islands (or simply the archipelago of the South Islands).
introduction.section2: Komodo is mainly famous for its huge lizard, the largest living in the world which owes its name from the island, the Komodo dragon. In addition to this National Park, you can also enjoy Flores Island, in Labuan Bajo, for accommodation or Rinca Island for diving or resting on the pink sand beaches.
introduction.section3: Find out our travelogue followed by our detailed visits.

title: Komodo
meta-description: Discover the Komodo Dragon National Park in Komodo, the pink sand beaches in Rinca, and rest on Flores Island in Labuan Bajo. For each place, we try to transcribe our visit as best as possible by telling you: Where to go? How to get there? Why? When? How long and at what period?
social-network-description: Komodo is mainly famous for its huge lizard, the largest living in the world which owes its name from the island, the Komodo dragon. In addition to this National Park, you can also enjoy Flores Island, in Labuan Bajo, for accommodation or Rinca Island for diving or resting on the pink sand beaches.
